greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Decimal expansion of 13-5*sqrt(5).
comment: Let d(n) = - 2*F(n) + h(2 + F(n+1), 1 + F(n+2)), where h = harmonic mean, F = A000045 (Fibonacci numbers).  Then floor(d(n)) = 2F(n) + 1 for n>1, and limit(d(n)) = 13 - 5*sqrt(5).
Apart from leading digits the same as A132338, A109866, A094874 and A079585. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jul 30 2013
link: Clark Kimberling, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
mathematica: f[n_] := Fibonacci[n]; h[n_] := HarmonicMean[{2 + f[n + 1], 1 + f[n + 2]}]; x = Limit[-2 f[n] + h[n], n -> Infinity] (* "proof" *)
results.author: _Clark Kimberling_, Jul 21 2013
